Reviews.Title: “beautiful suite, convenient location, reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: annamaria j
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel, very English friendly, good staff, most importantly the suite was stunning. had a whole kitchen that made me want to stay forever and super attractive and fun decor totally different than any "chain" hotel we usually stay in. Price was absolutely reasonable and location was nice and central. Great find!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: lyonnequeen
Reviews.Content: We paid $127 including all taxes for 1 night (Jan 1), with complimentary breakfast. Based on the price, I got exactly what I expected (and a bit more). The room was incredibly spacious and well appointed. Large flat screen tv, bed with duvet, several windows that opened (for fresh air), leather sofa, and stainless steel appliances in good working condition.The bathroom was ok. The closest elevator to our room was the old-school caged elevator. It was a little tricky to use at first since you had to line the elevator up direclty with the floor level or else the door wouldn't open. Front desk staff was great too. I agree with some of the other reviewers that the hotel finishings were not quite impeccable, but for my 1 night stay, I didn't really care. My friend's room looked much more fresh and finished than my room did. Overall, I'd probably stay here again and refer it to others. Note to the hotel: perhaps keep an iron and ironing board in the room so that your clients don't have to go pick one up from the front desk, and also maybe supply those 'do not disturb signs' to advise housekeeping to not come in the room.

Reviews.Title: “All Show”
Reviews.Author: FrangoToronto
Reviews.Content: The Loft Hotel was the worst hotel we have ever been too and we travel a lot! Its all show and no action. Yes the rooms are very spacious and modern, but please don't let this fool ya! We spent the wknd. in Montreal, overall, Montreal is an awesome city and we had a good time, but the hotel was a downer, i would give it a -1 rating if i could. We checked in Friday eve. at 7pm. we noticed that the room had no cable? in this day and age, no cable? we let it slip, then we noticed the toilet didn't work, so we called and asked to get it fixed, they said that is not possible until Monday and the customer service was beyond poor. They don't have any maintenance workers on site - not good for a hotel!! they put us in another room, again, all show, as it was very nice. After 1 shower, we noticed the water wasn't going anywhere, yup, the shower drain wasn't working, they put us in room #3, pls. note we stayed there for only 2 nights!!!! poor ratio if you ask me. The 3rd room was again nice (ALL SHOW), we noticed the room was very cold, we tried to increase the heat, but there was no HEAT, we called to complain about this, the hotel staff said the heat comes on at 6pm to 6am?!!, pls. note, its November in Montreal! What an INSANE rule to have!! We packed our things and left, after a threat or 2 we got some of our $ back and we went to another hotel nearby and enjoyed the rest of our stay, in a place that provided great customer service, with a simple room that had the essentials working with no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and modern decor but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Renee K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Loft Hotel for only one night. The rooms are modern, clean design and very large. I loved the floor to ceiling windows, but didn't have a view (looked onto another building in an alley). I didn't mind since we only stayed one night. If we stayed longer I would have asked for another room, which I'm sure they would have accommodated if available. The staff was extremely nice. The only complaint I have is the noise. There is no soundproofing. The guests staying above us got in at 3am, which we probably wouldn't have noticed if they had taken off their heels - clicking back and forth across the hardwood. At 9am people in the hallway outside our room were loudly setting up for an event or something in the room across from us. They woke us an hour before we planned to get up, which was unfortunate because the bed was very comfortable. Side note on cleanliness: overall the place was clean, but the washroom door looked like it hadn't been cleaned in months with smudges and finger prints all over it, and the sideboard in the dining area was noticeably dirty. These seem minor, but in a hotel of this level I expect everything to be clean. I am torn between liking and disliking this hotel based on the disruptions and cleanliness issues. Truthfully, I've stayed at the Opus in the past, and I will probably choose to stay there in the future. Similar prices, location, friendliness and modern decor, but without the issues.

Reviews.Title: “very modern place to stay”
Reviews.Author: themanda
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here one night, but the room was beautiful and huge! However, the hallways were very dark (painted dark gray and lit with small pot lights) to go with the very modern theme. The front desk staff was helpful. we had a giftcard for our stay but they were not aware of how to use it, but once they spoke to their manager it was all straightened out. there are a lot of restaurants and bars all along the street as well. overall we had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: JasonpCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights last weekend at the Loft Hotel - the rooms are just amazing, this is the largest room with the exception of some luxury suites, that we have ever stayed in. Really nicely designed, clean and tidy - please put some tea making facilities in the room but you can get refreshments within a two minute walk. Very well placed, friendly and helpful staff and would high recommend a stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Fabrice_et_Alice
Reviews.Content: This hotel doesn't look like any other one, simply surprising ! Lofts are very big (about 100 m2), and well equipped with in particular a large kitchen. The decoration in rooms and inside hotel is very original, urban and contemporary. The hotel is situated in a nice avenue, with many restaurants, stores, and close to the subway. The breakfast is light, and served in the hotel hall, so you'd rather take it in your loft. Rates are high, but you can always find a way to book cheaper. We strongly recommand this hotel, for few nights, one week or more.

Reviews.Title: “NIGHT FROM HELL - TERRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: Lu C
Reviews.Content: This hotel tries to be cool, tries to be happening and tries to be avant-garde, but it fails most miserably, unfortunately. I write this at quarter after midnight on my evening with the Loft, after the front desk boy banged on my door to see who was in the room. Across the hall from the room is a loud wedding party, complete with all the requisite cheers, thumping bass lines, and support staff rumbling down the hallway, just like Hitler through France... in the middle of the night. Earlier this afternoon, after we settled in, our door was opened by other "guests", who were sorry to barge in on us. Of course this was suspicious, so we checked our electronic keys and they no longer worked. The youngster at the front desk apologized and gave us new keys... At 23:30 (11:30 PM), the late-night front desk boy banged on our door, as I said earlier, asking who was in the room. I watched through the peep-hole as he tried using a key card to open the door. He wore no uniform, had no name tag or anything to identify that he worked for the hotel, yet demanded to know who was in the room -- RUDE and UNPROFESSIONAL!!! He then left, saying he would be back (???). I dressed and went to the front desk and asked for an explanation. I asked his name. I asked for the manager. I asked for the manager's name. I asked for a refund. He would give me nothing, but said I could move to another room (in the middle of the night with lots of luggage). By the way, these rooms have no phones and the silverware was missing from the kitchen. The bathroom door is supposed to have 5 panels of glass, but ours had only the top 4. The bottom glass panel was broken out when we arrived, obviously because the door opens into the toilet. There were holes in the walls around the switch-plates, as the construction crew failed to pay attention to details. Some of the lights in our room did not work - the lights were blown and never replaced. The "black-out" curtains did not cover all the windows, so we had some penetrating beams of light from the city all night. Unlike other hotels, this one uses a good old stack of paper and a single laptop for organization. The laptop is supposed to make the place look super modern, but the stack of paper on the desk is where the action is. The staff has no training in today's Stack-of-Paper Organization technique, nor do they have training in Customer Service. Good luck to you if you stay here. You will most likely get screwed... AND THEY COULD NOT CARE LESS.

Reviews.Title: “Unreliable booking with out of the air 'policies'”
Reviews.Author: salsawriter
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on reviews from expedia, hotels.com and trip advisor for this past long weekend. We arrived at the hotel at 1am after a long 7.5 hour journey from the Waterloo, only to find they had given away our reservation! Apparently, they have a late check-in policy which is NOTmentioned on their website or in the hotels.com confirmation, that they give away your reservation if you arrive past midnight. If you have a policy and there is a risk of losing your hotel room at least make that clear up front at the time of booking! So we were left stranded at 1am with a crying baby trying to find any vacancy at all for four days elsewhere. This defeated the whole purpose of booking in advance! We were even skeptical that they had ever had our reservation at all since there seemed to be no mention in the system. Overall a very disappointing experience. I will say that the clerk and manager at The Loft did assist us in finding other accomodations so that was nice of them. We were left disillusioned with a bad feeling from this whole experience. After returning home, we reviewed the site and confirmation receipt and THERE IS NO MENTION OF LOSING YOUR BOOKING FOR A LATE CHECK IN. So that's it in a nutshell. We ended up staying in the Novotel close the the airport. It was far but very comfortable, reasonable and most importantly, RELIABLE!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms but a very weird hotel”
Reviews.Author: troybe
Reviews.Content: Due to our missing reservation at a hotel down the road we were relocated to the Loft Hotel for 4 nights. Amazed at the size of the rooms we were happy to stay here. Although after a night and a better look at the bizarre hotel we found the place to be weird. The hotel had a half finished feel about it. Im still waiting for a staff member to say hello. There was no information about the hotel anywhere. The outside of the hotel was flithy and neglected. It was extremely hard to sleep as the sun beamed in through curtains as there was no blind. The corridors were dark and stank and anybody could just walk in off the street and sleep in a ballroom if they felt like it. Very poor security. The room maintenance was poor. Missing light bulbs, stains down the walls, no wine glasses ( its okay we bought some at a store for you ) Im glad we never paid the full rate for this hotel as the service and sheer weirdness of this hotel is a turn off. Also any person that chooses to stay in this area be aware of filthy homeless and beggars everywhere. You never know, they may be sleeping in one of the creepy dark corridors in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing. Rooms are HUGE!”
Reviews.Author: KipF
Reviews.Content: An amazing place to stay. The rooms are all enormous!! The property is in an excellent location with easy access to public transit or a short walk to neighborhood restaurants/bars or a stroll in the village. We felt very safe, even when walking in the area at night. The room was quiet and very nicely furnished. Staff were all helpful and friendly. The chocolate croissants that are served at breakfast are delicious - and they don't mind if you fix a plate and take it back to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: samenco
Reviews.Content: At first, I did not know what to expect. Given the [low] rate for the room, I thought that the photos had to be seriously touched up. The photos were nice, but they really did NOT do this place justice. By the look of the place from the outside, you'd NEVER know what to expect on the inside. Sparce, modern and minimalist. No check in desk, just a receptionist waiting to check you in. Took less than five minutes to receive our room key. I opened the door and our mouths dropped in awe. What a FABULOUS room. Glassed in bathroom with a large soaking tub. The view of the city was nice, the bed was wonderful and the place was QUIET. The room came with a "Continental Breakfast." It was a little sparce, but hey, how could I complain? Don't look for the usual amenities like a mini bar in the room. We had to ask for an iron, and there wasn't a dresser to put our clothes in. We had to live out of our suitcase. I didn't care. Parking is $20/day and is located in the back of the building. One block walk to the Metro and a couple of stops to downtown or Old Town. Restaurants on St. Denis (Latin Quarter) are plentiful, but be forwarned, most of them close at 10pm. If you want a late dinner, you'll have to go to another section of town. We give this place two thumbs WAY up... A+... When in Montreal for our next trip, we will not be staying ANY OTHER PLACE but the LOFT HOTEL!! ;-D

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel concept let down by its finish”
Reviews.Author: nownownoonoo
Reviews.Content: In a fit of spontaneity, my boyfriend booked a room at the Loft Hotel so we could enjoy Canada Day in Montreal. The hotel room was more per night than we would usually pay, but my boyfriend was keen to check out this quirky boutique hotel. We arrived at the hotel at 3pm. The receptionist was friendly and promptly got us checked in. We were then shown to our room by a man we assumed to be the hotel manager, or perhaps owner. He told us about the hotel. That it opened in 2010 and it was popular with celebrities and politicians, suggesting quality and luxury. We were taken down to the second floor in a freight elevator which had been furnished to look like a sitting room. We both had smiles on our faces as we enjoyed the novelty. The hotel manager continued to tell us about the hotelâ€™s quirks as he proudly showed us round our room. All the while he was talking I couldnâ€™t help but feel disappointed. I didnâ€™t think room was in any way luxurious, and to me it was reminiscent of a student apartment, with its mismatched furniture and â€“ in my opinion - dismal bathroom. As it was a treat organised by my boyfriend, I didnâ€™t want to be negative about the room, but once we were alone he said he was disappointed too. I went to use the bathroom, and when I noticed there was a tile missing behind the bathroom door and paint on the floor, it helped me make my decision to complain. At reception I spoke to the manager whoâ€™d shown us to our room. I said we were disappointed because we didnâ€™t think the quality of the room reflected the rate weâ€™d paid. He was very calm and polite (like me, I hope). He told me he was very sorry, but the hotel was full, but after a bit more discussion he said heâ€™d see what he could do. Five to 10 minutes later, he came back and said there was another room we could have, and he showed me to an enormous suite on the fourth floor. My boyfriend and I were really pleased with the huge bathroom with a double-width shower and standalone bath; seating area with two sofas, an armchair and a coffee table; and the biggest softest bed. We had a comfortable stay, but if Iâ€™m honest I donâ€™t think I would stay at the Loft Hotel again. To me it seemed that it had opened six months before it was ready to. Things seemed to have been rushed compromising the quality of the finish. Even in our second room, there were two window blinds missing. The hotel certainly has potential. It's in a fun part of town and the concept is good. I hope they can get on top of things and make it the hotel they obviously want it to be.

Reviews.Title: “Splash out on one of the more expensive rooms if you can...tremendous!”
Reviews.Author: mark-english1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend last night (1 July) after an impromptu road trip to Montreal. Not sure what the regular rates were but we paid 219 CAD excl. tax for an urban loft (guess they might have hiked the prices up for Canada Day!). We were escorted to our room (#201) by a gentleman from reception. He took us on the freight lift which they converted into a funky boudoir like room which they apparently hire out for small parties...really whacky! However, we were quite disappointed when we got to our room. It was certainly big enough but it was a little shabby in places, particularly the bathroom. I could tell my g/f was a little disappointed. If we'd have paid $100-150 then we would have probably just taken it on the chin but as it was I think we both felt a little short changed. Anyway, my g/f headed back to reception to confess that we both felt really disappointed with the room. The hotel initially played the old 'We're fully booked' card but soon after the gentleman trudged off to 'see what he could do.' He came back shortly later and confessed he had another room for us (#406). "So you like nice bathrooms?" he said as he opened the door. This room was awesome...chandeliers, leather couches, drinks trolleys, you name it! Oh and the bathroom...a huge stand alone bathtub was the icing on the cake. I should probably mention that we don't normally complain when out in hotels/restaurants - I normally feel to embarrassed to! However I think if you go about it in the right way then they will try to help out...that's certainly what happened at the Loft Hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a stay in Montreal. We got lucky in being upgraded but if you can afford to splash a bit more cash for one of the Executive Lofts you definitely should. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “perfect urban experience, not a typical hotel”
Reviews.Author: crinkie
Reviews.Content: My bf and I stayed at the Loft Hotel for 2 nights this week. We loved the spacious lofts (had the chance to see 2), with the massive windows and the modern and clean style. Comfy beds and sofas! Modern Ikea style kitchens. The location is perfect! Right downtown Montreal, 10-15 min walk from everything you'd want to see. Everything was clean, the towels were changed and the bed made everyday. The staff was really nice and extra efficient (quickly got upgraded to a bigger loft after technical issues with the first loft bathroom). Breakfast is basic but good. There are still some renovations being made in the hallways. Wiring of the phones in each room is currently being done we were told. Until then, you have to call the reception with your own cellphone. The windows are old (windowsills are cracked) but you can't hear the traffic outside or your loft neighbor. Loved the overall experience, exactly the urban feel we were going for.

Reviews.Title: “Without a Doubt the best property I've ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: SalahEL
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Loft Hotel for 2 months in April and May 2011. I have to say this was my most enjoyable stay at any hotel to date, and I am a frequent traveller, averaging over 50,000 miles a year. I come to Montreal at least 4 times a year, so I have spent a few too many nights at hotels in my life. So why did I like this specific property so much? Firstly, let's start with first impression and looks. As someone who loves good modern/contemporary design, when I first set my eyes on the lofts in this hotel, I was blown away. The lofts are a page out of Wallpaper. Whoever designed these apartments deserves an award. Old, industrial loft charm with high end, modern, designer furniture and new appliances, all very tastefully put together, down to the colour of and art on the walls. I liked it so much that I immediately started snapping pictures thinking this is how my next apartment is going to look like. The lofts are very spacious, giving you "the dream apartment away from my apartment" feel, if that makes sense. Secondly, the staff. Unlike the typical, overly professional and somewhat depersonalized treatment one would get at a typical 5 star hotel (and yes this is the league we should be referencing this hotel to), the staff here totally go out of their way to help and make sure a client enjoys their stay. They are relaxed, friendly, and always took care of even the smallest detail on the spot. They take their time with each customer so you feel like you're talking to a friend who genuinely cares whether you enjoy your stay or not. Thirdly, comfort. The beds and furniture in these apartments are very comfortable, so it's not just all image and no substance, and believe me I've stayed at quite a few of those even in Montreal, where it's like my sofa is great to look at but not to sit on. This adds up to comfy stay and good night sleeps. Finally, location. The loft is situated right on Montreal's busiest entertainment, bar, cafe and restaurant street, without the street noise. Why? The hotel is on a tiny street right off St Denis called terrace St Denis, it was done in a strange way where you technically are right on St Denis, you see it out of your window, but its built a level above the street and you have to take a little ramp to get to it. I have to admit that when I first looked at this hotel's reviews before I moved in, I was taken back by the more negative reviews on here. Having stayed here for 2 months, I feel compelled to address some of these issues if anything out of courtesy to the bold step taken by the owners and staff to bring this project to life: Yes, the hotel is new. It's 1 yr old now. There are a couple of details that still need a work out. 1- The phones, yes, there are no phones here in the rooms. Yet that is. While that didn't bother me because I got myself a tourist pre-paid cell phone for 30 bucks a month, I can see why it would bother someone who's here for 2 nights. But the hotel is having them installed shortly. Secondly, yes, there is no big restaurant and the breakfast area is small, again, this is because the hotel is new and this is in the works, but, you're right on St Denis and there is every type of food you can dream of within 2-5 minutes of walking, some open 24/7. 3- The noise: I haven't experienced this since I got here, there haven't been any parties and I see a security guy twice my size walking around the corridors at night to make sure all is quiet and safe (and I'm 6'2'' so imagine what he looks like). I do understand however from the staff that they did have issues with noise in the past because people would throw loud parties, while now they don't tolerate that anymore (though get togethers and dinners are fine, i.e. they haven't gone to the other extreme). I think it's only normal that with lofts this spacious and well designed, guests would have been inspired to throw a party and invite everyone they can think of to their place, it does look better than most clubs or bars. But again, this hasn't happened in my 2 months here. All in all, while there was a noise problem that's no longer there, and while the features I mentioned above are still in the works, everything else more than makes up for this, and I am never booking another hotel in Montreal. In sum, the owners and management decided to build a project that raised the bar in Montreal's hotel industry. Typically, good hotels offer comfort, convenience and luxury, while sacrificing space. Here, you're getting a real loft apartment, fully equipped, with the same comfort, luxury and location as a trendy 5 star hotel, and a staff that cares. While a couple of the convenience factors like phone and room service are still in the works, I think this property already beats any where I've ever stayed, and once the missing features are installed, well, suck to own another hotel because the bar's been totally raised.

Reviews.Title: “NOT SAFE, might be nice rooms but...”
Reviews.Author: yowtravellers
Reviews.Content: To All Woman travelling Alone - Do not go to this boutique hotel. Their is no security, the hallways are very dark and many doors that aren't identified, no reception desk, (just an unorganized desk when you arrive with 1 person working there). No concierge, it's a 1 man show & NO Phones in room, so if you have a complaint you have to go down to the mainfloor and find the person who is working. My partner and I went there this past weekend for a romantic quiet getaway and I must say that the room was very clean, very spacious and nice, but the rest of the hotel is where the problem lies. We had booked on-line and booked for 1pm check-in, and when we got there the room was late by 2 hours. The people staying next door to us were having a crazy loud party (with mega bass, etc), so at around 10:30pm we walked down to the "reception desk" (cause no phone in rooms) and they knew about the party that was going on next door to ours. They said that they couldn't switch us rooms cause they were full. The guy working the desk went to warn them that they were going to get an extra charge to their bill if they continued, and they obviously didn't care, so they continued to have their party. Shortly after 11pm, my partner and I had enough so we check-out of this hotel extremly dissapointed, we had to find a hotel that can accomodate us at 11pm, take a taxi and leave). It was horrible..& it was my birthday. :(

Reviews.Title: “Interesting, Quirky, Work in Progress, Not suited for some - great for others”
Reviews.Author: cyberi
Reviews.Content: First of all this will have to be a lenghty review as this is a complex hotel experience that warrants full disclosure of what I found. The Loft hotel is a work in progress. It is unique in its styling, service offering and accomodations. But this hotel is not suited to all travelers in my opinion. My trip to Montreal for a few nights was a leisurely one where I needed to find a hotel with enough space to feel comfortable if I had to stay in due to weather and close enough to activity so I could explore the edgy parts of Montreal. The Loft actually worked well for me as I was traveling with my daughter and her girl friend and needed two rooms in walking distance with enough space so they wouldn't get on each others nerves. The Loft actually turned out to be a perfect choice. BUT I would not stay here on a business trip, or if I was traveling with less adventurous tourists. The Hotel is actually a converted parking garage of some sort. Most rooms come equipped with a full kitchen with new appliances so you can eat in if you like. The continental breakfast they claim to offer makes Hampton Inn seem like a gourmet restaurant so bring food or be preapred to go out for a hearty breakfast if you want more than fruit loops, granola or danish. There is a good breakfast spot down the hill on St Denis that I recommend for a quick breakfast. But the very positive side is the rooms are quite, quite large. The room I stayed in was huge - so much in fact that I had to deal with an echo when I was using skype for a call. However your experience in this hotel is dependent on the room you get. The pictures on their site are accurate (for some rooms) but do not necessarily reflect all. SO here are the details. Once you find the hotel, which in itself can be a challenge as it is tucked away on a side street off of a main drag, you walk into a lobby that will immediately let you know you are not in your typical hotel. I have stayed in Hampton Inns and Four Seasons around the world and I recognize the hotel experience well. The Loft hotel break that perception from the start. Check in was quick, flawless as we were greated by a cheery young woman sittng at a desk in the lobby that reminded me of Ikea style furniture. She had a laptop a folder with check in detail and that was it. After check in I unloaded the bags (for myself and 2 young girls (18)) into the lobby. They were loaded on a traditional bell cart and rolled out to the elevator where I was informed I would be staying n the lower floors. OKAY! Next we waited for the elevator to take us down two levels. It tooks some time to arrive and had a sofa in it and two chairs. The elevator obviously was built to hoist cars because its size was about the size of hotel rooms I have stayed in on Central Park South in New York. Once we boarded we descended two flights and came out in what seemed to be the basement or basement like setting. The halls reminded me of an institution (hospital, mental or other). But I was still interested and enjoying the innovative approach. Wondering what was next. The first room, my daughter's, was huge. Complete with full kitchen, area for watching TV, King Size bed, surronded by windows with a decent sized bathroom - sparse but functional accomodations. It was actually perfect. Livable for these two friends with enough space for each to wander and operate separately. It was well lit BUT cold. There was a standalone heater in the room and a wall unit that was not really functioning well. The view from the room? Well luckily the curtains are floor to cieling. Back alleys are not that picturesque even in Montreal. My room was next to that one. It was also huge. very sparsly furnished, with a monesary feel, with a concrete floor with cracks that reminded me of my basement back home in New England. The bed was firm and comfortable. The dining table was central, with four chair and large enough for a family to sit and enjoy meals. There was a sitting area for watching the flat screen wall mounted TV. The bathroom was a good size also. To be honest this was perfect for me - especially at the discounted rate I got for the two rooms. Although I noticed the peeling paint on the concrete post, the pipes that ran through the room that provided background noise when the guests on higher floors used their facilities, and the fact that my room was very hot with no way to control the temp - I was fine with it all. I had much work to get done and needed a place to crash that was livable. However, I knew that these rooms were discounted and wanted to see what other rooms might look like so the management was kind enough (especially since I told them I was going to review the hotel) to show me other rooms on the main floor. It was like night and day. We were obviously put in the "low rent" units in the lower floors while the main floor and upper floor had the most elegant, well appointed and above all spacious rooms. The Loft hotel is a work in progress. To be fair to the developers, it is innovative in its approach, edgy in its styling but suited for the younger or more adventurous traveler. If you are most comfortable in the traditional hotel setting, this is probably not your hotel. However if you have experienced timeshares around the world this would be more equivalent to the experience you might get. They are building out the units and the systems while renting to guests. The traditional tourist may have difficulty when they realize there is no ironing board, in room phones or central lobby. But I would stay here again and would advise the managers, developers, owners to provde ALL guests with a tour of the hotel - which is impressive. Since we booked and stayed in the "cheap seats" my review would have been much different if I had not seen the other sections of the hotel. The location is great for the young tourist as St Denis is filled with pubs, restaurants and young people exhibiting their broad diversity of expression. Overall if you are between 25 - 40, with enough money to pay their rates, without the expectations of the uniformity of Hampton Inn or the posh luxury of a Four Seasons this is worth a look. But if you are a traveler expecting to find everything you might find in a more traditional hotel and ready to compalin about what is missing - you will have many things to complain about. This is a quirky place. I encourage the management of this hotel to contiune with the work they are doing and would look forward to being invited back - this time to stay in the more lavish units so that I can provide my Trip Advisor travelers with a review of that ("higher end" experience as well. The ballroom is amazing and I could see a wedding couple taking over the hotel and using the massive rooms for guests and the lavish suites for their honeymoon stay. FOr those aunts and uncles and other relatives that you had to invite but don't really care for - book the lower floors and relegate them to those adequate and functional rooms. Overall - Innovative, edgy, very different, definately not for everyone - many would hate it and many would love it. I would stay again and hope to review again when its is completed next year.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel & accomodating staff! Would definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: emamabear
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at the Loft Hotel for my birthday weekend in early April, and we had an amazing time. Once we opened the door to our loft, we were stunned at how gorgeous it was - MASSIVE, modern, ecclectic, and furnished with quality fixtures and furniture. As soon as we entered the room we immediately started snapping photos to send to our friends at home to show them how nice it was. Despite what previous reviews have said, the room was very clean. We also had no issues with any sounds from our neighbours, and the room was a bit too hot one morning but you are given a remote control to adjust the temperature settings in the room, so that solved it. The hotel was close to everything - literally only 5 minute drives to everywhere we wanted to go (clubs, restaraunts, shoppings, etc). The staff was also amazing - they all spoke English very well, were very bubbly, and wanted to ensure we had the best stay possible. The only reccommendations I have for them is to keep the continental breakfast replenished until 10 am :) Overall, we LOVED it! We would absolutely 100% stay here again, and hope we do at some point in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we expected”
Reviews.Author: sweets82
Reviews.Content: I was weary about this hotel after reading the negative reviews on tripadvisor, however it was not at all what people were saying. The staff was AMAZING. The receptionist brought us to our room and explained everything perfectly. After she left, we noticed we were missing the Ipod dock and she had given us her cell number so we called and she delivered right away. It's a great loft experience on a main street in downtown Montreal for such an afordable price. A great alternative to a regular hotel room. Continental breakfast included in the morning which we brought back to our room. Our rooms had a fully equipped kitchen which came in handy, the room was super clean, the bathroom very nice, the bedding so comfortable. The hotel itself was not fully completed in their renovations, but had no effect on our stay. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “THE SINGLE MOST POORLY RUN HOTEL IN THE COUNTRY.”
Reviews.Author: calirock
Reviews.Content: Dealing with this hotel was one of the most horrible experiences I've ever had to deal with on a vacation. I don't even know where to begin. From the moment I walked into the hotel, the staff treated me and my cousin with disrespect. Someone from the staff came down to our room almost every hour for no reason. We felt like we were in a dorm and we were being babysat. We repeatedly offered to leave the hotel if we were causing any sort of problem but they insisted that we stayed. We were NOT being loud, we abided by their rules, and there were absolutely NO complaints about our room (we asked if anyone had complained about us and they claimed that no one had). There were hotel rooms upstairs that had a minimum of 40 people present and they suffered NO fine and NO harassment. We were singled out the second we walked into this hotel. We were cooperative with the contract that we had to sign. Funny thing, the hotel was not cooperative with the contract that they had provided. While my cousin and I were out on the town, the hotel accepted $100 and LET PEOPLE INTO OUR ROOM, causing them to fine me $200 the next morning (which was NOT in the contract). They claimed that it was a cancellation fee but the cancellation fee is $200. They accepted $100 and allowed people into our room behind our backs. There was supposed to be a $30 fee for every extra person who slept in the room (no one slept in our room). As we were checking out, the lady at the front desk claimed that the $200 charge was for some fire extinguisher incident that happened in our hallway WHILE MY COUSIN AND I WERE OUT. Because it happened in the hallway that my room was located in, they decided that they should throw that charge onto my bill. I made the mistake of paying them (they only let me pay them in cash.. which I thought was very sketchy). Different people at the hotel have told me that the $200 charge is for different things. One claimed it was for extra people in the room (we had no more than 10 people in our room), and one claimed that it was for some fire extinguisher incident. No one at that hotel can seem to get their story straight. That's when I knew that they had been scamming me for my money. I spent almost $700 on a $250 hotel room because of their hassles. I spent a week, after my stay, trying to deal with this hotel. The woman that we spoke to on the phone was extremely rude, condescending, and even racist. She made a comment saying along the lines of "we don't like those kind of people in our hotel" (referring to a few of my friends). Also, the manager threatened us when we requested to speak with him. I've never EVER been so disrespected by a company before. I didn't even know that service (especially at a hotel) could ever be this horrible. I've called my credit card company to contest the charges put onto my card and I've called Canada's consumer protection. I'm almost to the point where I am going to get my lawyer involved. It's worth the justice.

Reviews.Title: “hotel infested by ants ! worst experience ever.”
Reviews.Author: sofiesticate
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very modern design ! It was the only good thing about the Loft Hotel. Once we checked in the day of our arrival, we had to sign some kind of contract that doesn't allowed us to invite some friends over to visit us. The room was over heated. They told us we couldnt lower the heat because the system was central. so we had to sleep with the windows open (during winter ! ) ! When we woke up in the morning we discovered an important amount of ants on the flour around our bed ! we were on the 5ft floor.... so this infestation must be really major ! The door of our "luxurious" sauna/room wasnt closing properly... The hotel is still under construction The receptionnist is rude The cleaning staff doesnt wear uniforms and doesnt have a vaccum ! ! ! ! The breakfast area is ridiculously small ! The reception area... consist of a white table.... with some handwritten dossier. That was the worst experience ever in a hotel in montreal..

Reviews.Title: “Good but strange and loud at night”
Reviews.Author: bkwrtr14
Reviews.Content: Loved the rooms, huge with warehouse renovated feel and for the most part quiet until friday night when partiers spilled into the hallways until 3 am maybe later, might as well be in the room with you. Cement hallways echoing. No one on duty to deal with it. During the week it was great - location is perfect, room was clean and staff was pleasant breakfast is a joke, however the neighborhood provides. Management will have to decide if they want to cater to party people or repeat guests. Avoid like the plague on weekends, if you are looking for R&R.

Reviews.Title: “lots of space - not yet sorted”
Reviews.Author: Odessasteppe
Reviews.Content: I love the location of this hotel and the rooms themselves were fantastic, and the beds very comfortable but on our second night - there was a bachelor party in an adjacent room that spilled out into the hall and in front of our room - incredible noise from 3am on. At maybe 4am my boyfriend went out to ask the crew to keep it down - and there was hostility and veiled threats. And the noise and music went on and on and at no point did the hotel staff step in. Apparently, everyone complained but nothing was done. Our sleep was fitful at best and thus we awoke quite late. When we asked for a late checkout (based on having sleep stolen from us) we were given a scant 10-20 minutes. And the food offered for breakfast was meagre and there was only one table that sat four people. Bit confusing. A great place if you want lots of space and home comforts like a kitchen. we got a deal at 169! But some guests clearly ride roughshod over others with impunity. And noise really travels through the building.

Reviews.Title: “Like others have said... not ready for prime time.”
Reviews.Author: edvfr
Reviews.Content: I liked the funky looks of the hotel but it's not finished. Their hotel business appears to be secondary to their hosting services. The room was OK but it lacked things like a closet, water glasses, and such. If you can get a good rate during the week and there are no events in the "hotel" it may be worth considering. Otherwise, find a place that is more quiet and complete.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure your room is INSIDE the actual hotel. otherwise, best to avoid it”
Reviews.Author: bonsai35
Reviews.Content: Huh. I'm not sure what to make of this place. Its' not really a hotel at all (at least where we stayed for four of our five nights there, which turned out to be an apartment down the street from the actual "hotel" address). it turns out that we were given a sort of studio apartment which was quite a ways away from the hotel lobby. This sort of odd set up was kind of ok for us since we were there for a combination of business / leisure and were able to be pretty flexible but if I was travelling for business and planned on having certain amenities that you usually need or expect when on the road for work, I would have been sorely disappointed. Like I said, we were put in a sort of studio unit quite a ways down the street from the rest of the "hotel" and the lobby. The hotel address is Terrasse St. Denis, which if you google it, is an offshoot of the very busy and very loud Rue St Denis. Our room (studio apartment) was right ON St. Denis, across the street from a very loud club and our bed was directly in front of the window on the street. i would never want to stay here if I needed to sleep with the windows open. But honestly, the noise factor is sort of the least of the problems if you get this unit. There was a full kitchen, as in it had appliances, and was in a separate space of the apartment, but it was not outfitted with many of the necessities. There was a coffee maker, but no complimentary coffee or even coffee filters. There were empty salt and pepper shakers. There were wine glasses but no water glasses. There was a dishwasher but no dishwashing liquid or sponge or dish soap. There was a beautiful dining room table and some cheap dishes, but no napkins or even paper towels. So picture having to use toilet paper for dinner napkins. we did finally get hand soap on the second day after requesting it. There was no garbage can in our bathroom. There was no iron or ironing board and no hair dryer and there was no in-room phone so if you need to call the front desk, you need to use your own cell phone (expensive if youâ€™re not from the area). There was an ipod player and clock but the ipod player sounded tinny and cheap and the clock feature was actually broken. The back window didnâ€™t close and wasnâ€™t fixed for three days (brrrr!). AND â€“ my husband went out back one morning and found a junkie on the fire escape, along with a slew of syringes scattered around. This is not the best area of town and being that you donâ€™t have any protection or insulation in the form of a lobby, you could quite possibly find some rather unsavory characters not only in the general area but right outside your back door. Not cool. There was also an alley directly across the street from the front door of our apartment which had obvious drug-dealing activities. if you do plan to stay here, plan on having to go to the store and spend quite a bit of $ on the basic necessities that you would need to stay in a place like this: paper towels, salt and pepper, bottled water, napkins, coffee, coffee filters, etc. The room looked nice and it had large, heavy furnishings that looked expensive, but someone just overlooked alot of details other than decorating. if you look close, there's even some oddities there; an antique-looking chair that's about to fall apart, a bedside table that leans at a very precarious angle, a dresser that is propped up on one side by scraps of wood blocks. For real. it' ON Rue St,, Denis, so if you want to be in the middle of the nightlife, this could be a great place to stay but itâ€™s not the best area and I would never want to stay here with kids. If you prefer something quieter, this is defintiely not the place for you. To be fair, after the incident with the junkie on our fire escape, they moved us to a room inside the hotel and it was spacious and lovely and the kitchen WAS outfitted with the things you would need: water glasses, a cutting board, paper towelsâ€¦.. but still no complimentary coffee supplies or salt and pepper. And there was a hair dryer there. But I guess you take your chances with whether you get a room in the actual hotel which is insulated from the street by a lobby and is much safer or whether you get â€œan upgraded apartmentâ€� (ha!) that is actually an isolated apartment right on the street.

Reviews.Title: “the loft hotel montreal”
Reviews.Author: turbo34
Reviews.Content: the hotel was not ready it was a complete mess the room was good and the hotel when finnished will be lovley there was no fire procedure in the rooms there was no iron no towels had to get them from reception no phone no complimentry tea or cofee had to sit in reception to eat brekfast or take to room booked a room with a bath and got a shower under the bed was filthy no idea of clenliness the lift was a death trap used the stairs even though had very heavy case braught the manager to the room and he agreed with us and gave us 50% off the stay would advise people to get in touch with him because 400 pounds for 3 nights is a rip off at a half finnished car park

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with potential, problems with cleanliness and details ...”
Reviews.Author: eclipticon
Reviews.Content: Instead of a room in the Loft Hotel itself, we were assigned to a room directly on Rue St. Denis, an upgrade as we were told. The room was very spacious, with nice furniture and a fully equipped kitchen. However, this "upgrade" meant for us that it was very loud at night (there is quite some night life on St Denis!), that no WiFi (as advertised) was available and that we had to bring our breakfast across the street to our room. The bathroom is quite stylish but not functional at all ... no space to put down anything, the number of fresh towels each day varies. The room was also anything but clean, with loads of dust and clipped fingernails on the floor ... So a hotel with quite some potential, but lacking the details ... we recommend not to accept any "upgrades" whatsoever ...

Reviews.Title: “Not Ready for Guests Yet”
Reviews.Author: CalibHfx
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights on a weekend trip for fun. Our taxi driver found the location after a few attempts. The loft rooms are spacious and well decorated. After the stay we felt this was not really a hotel quality stay, but more like a VRBO or long term stay. No in room phones, ironing boards, irons, guest directories, fire exit procedures, etc. The cleanliness is not hotel level, more like a weekly rental accommodation. The concept and property has great potential, but there was a great deal of work going on and drywall dust was everyewhere. The construction work starts early, so sleeping in is not an option. We had a backed-up shower our first morning and moved to another loft for the second night. It was equally large and well decorated. Would work better for an extended business stay. Not sure if I would return though for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “two weeks home away from home”
Reviews.Author: SunnyB76
Reviews.Content: I spent two weeks in the loft hotel before it was completely finished at the end of May. The owner and his staff were amazing, very personable and the hotel was truly incredible. My first week I stayed in an urban loft then upgraded to an executive loft. The place was dusty and still being worked on but the rooms were beyond what I expected. The lofts are huge, even the urban loft itself was massive and the furnishings are top notch. I loved every minute of my stay at loft hotel and I will for sure go back.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed ! Good job Montreal !”
Reviews.Author: JakyD
Reviews.Content: Me and a bunch of friends decided that to celebrate our graduation, we would make a trip to Montreal. We browsed a bit online and discovered this 'loft hotel'. we called and asked and what made us first decide on this place was actually the fact that they had quite big rooms ( we were a few to chill and we wanted to chill all together in the same room before going to bed separately ) I have to admit, we were a bit skeptical because people didn't seem to know the street the hotel was at ( Terrasse St-Denis ) We thought we were screwed but one step in the hotel and we were instantly reassured. The lobby itself is a piece of art. My gosh it was huge and pretty. And when they showed us where we would be staying... i knew i was going to fall in love with this place even before the end of my stay. It was big, it was clean, it was modern, it was wow. We were taking pictures like crazy, as if it was the hotel was an tourist spot itself. To sum it up, it exceeded beyond my expectations ! But... there's always a but, it had a few lackings though. We kinda wished they would have a restaurant and a bar within the hotel. Would've loved to chill out at the bar, go clubbing and come back for beers in our own room ... but oh well, we were able to manage. So!! all in all, one of the best places i've stayed at !! We all came back home, amazed and satisfied!
